div1.head: Military Orders for Roger Post Ames, July 7, 1900
div1.p:
HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF HAVANA
AND PINAR DEL RIO.

1. Acting Assistant Surgeon Roger P. Ames, U.S. Army,
will proceed to Guanajay Barracks, Cuba, for the purpose
of investigating and reporting upon all circumstances con-
nected with the case of yellow fever recently reported at
that post.

Upon completion of this duty Acting Assistant Surgeon
Ames will rejoin his proper station.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

2. Upon the recommendation of his battery and regi-
mental commanders, the unexecuted portion of the sentence
in the case of Private Charles J. Luna, Battery H, 2d Artil-
lery, promulgated in paragraph 5, Special Orders No. 265,
series 1899, Headquarters Department of Havana, is here-
by remitted.

3. Private Hugh Friel, Company G, 8th Infantry, having
been tried by a general court-martial convened at Columbia
Barracks, Cuba, and found guilty of conduct to the preju-
dice of good order and military discipline (three previous
convictions), was sentenced “To forfeit ten (10) dollars of his
pay.”
The sentence is approved, and will be duly executed.
BY COMMAND OF BRIGADIER GENERAL LEE:

R. E. L. MICHIE,
Assistant Adjutant General.
